Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can draw a healthy, growing plant that receives water, displaying bright colors and upright stems and leaves.
The student can draw a wilting plant that does not receive water, with drooping stems and discolored leaves.
The student can include details such as soil moisture, healthy roots, and vibrant foliage in the watered plant, indicating an understanding of water's role in plant health.
The student can accurately compare and contrast the healthy appearance of a plant with water to the struggling appearance of one without, showing understanding through clear visual differences.
The student can depict patterns in plant health by illustrating multiple plants with varying degrees of water and corresponding health states.
CANNOT: The student may occasionally omit minor details when focusing on larger elements of the drawing (e.g., not shading in soil).
The student might not perfectly proportion every element, such as the exact length of each leaf, but this does not affect the overall understanding.
